text: Some form of Interface-based "Last Updated" and/or "Date added" indicator on HubDB Rows would be Suuuuuuper useful - it's frustrating to have to query the API to get this information when trying to perform quick audits on data entry / row updates

I think the solution is two-fold if it’s physically possible to make the new menu a user preference essentially instead of whole portal, that’s a better way for people to transition. For example our company manages 50+ HS sites, it’d be great if we could opt ourselves in to these features that don’t dramatically affect functionality, without opting clients in.


If not:  I guess putting in the notification in some visually bold way something that indicates that everyone will be notified that you specifically made the change would be good.

from an agency perspective we’re like - “sweet a new tool to make us more efficient. ” because we’re in HS every day, and know the tools like the back of our hands.

The client’s perspective is - “I’m in HubSpot maybe once a week. ”
“everythings changing, every time I come in here things are in different places…”

Thus they are less likely to want to change their main nav over as that means re-learning what they already don’t feel they know well enough. but if they can wait just a little longer and choose to learn it at a different time they’re happier.
